channel.title: Port Forwarding
channel.description: Well, I have a wireless Verizon (DirectTV) Modem for internet. I use a laptop. I didn't think I need to port forward, but I tried it with utorrent anyway. I still couldn't connect with the player's client, and add it to the server list. Do I need to port forward for this?

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Port forward related topics aren’t allowed, just use the guides provided in the tutorial section or http://portforward.com

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Lahdeedah2 Lahdeedah2
item.description:
@Lahdeedah2 wrote:

[quote=“tragicguy, post:6, topic:295243”]ok ill tell u how (first close no-ip and u torrent and your source folder)
~Steps~
1.open up no-ip and click your host name make shur that it is smily face:P
2.open up your source folder hit run it should run ur server.
3.now open up utorrent make shur the port is at 43594
4 close your server and run it again
5.CONGRATZ IT’S NOW PUBLIC[/quote]Thank you very much. I was doing it in all the wrong order.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @tragicguy tragicguy
item.description:
@tragicguy wrote:

ok ill tell u how (first close no-ip and u torrent and your source folder)
~Steps~
1.open up no-ip and click your host name make shur that it is smily face:P
2.open up your source folder hit run it should run ur server.
3.now open up utorrent make shur the port is at 43594
4 close your server and run it again
5.CONGRATZ IT’S NOW PUBLIC

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding
item.dc:creator: @Guthix_Rox Guthix Rox
item.description:
@Guthix_Rox wrote:

If you reset your router:
Id: admin
Password: password1
Otherwise it may be something different… Or if you lucky it’ll be the default.
Router Password List: http://www.phenoelit-us.org/dpl/dpl.html

Read full topic
